ALICE.description: Improving the management of Atlantic Landscapes: accounting for biodiversity and ecosystem services

observables.label: Organic Carbon Mass
observables.description: The total amount of stored carbon originating from ecosystem processes. Includes organic matter in the soil, roots and aerial vegetation.

observables.label: Vegetation Carbon Mass
observables.description: The total amount of stored carbon in vegetation, including roots and aerial parts.

observables.label: Net value of Pollination
observables.description: The net value of pollination, showing the balance between demand and actual provision in each point of the landscape.

observables.label: Occurrence of Pollinator Insects
observables.description: The likelihood of finding pollinator insects in each point, composed of a wheather and a landscape component.

observables.label: Weather suitability for Pollinator Insects
observables.observable: occurrence of agriculture:Pollinator biology:Insect caused by earth:Weather
observables.description: The weather-related component of the likelihood of finding pollinator insects in each point.

observables.label: Landscape suitability for Pollinator Insects
observables.observable: occurrence of agriculture:Pollinator biology:Insect caused by ecology:Landscape
observables.description: The landscape-related component of the likelihood of finding pollinator insects in each point.

observables.label: Proneness to flooding
observables.observable: im:Potential proportion of earth:PrecipitationVolume causing earth:Flood
observables.description: The flood hazard based on topographic wetness index, precipitation and temperature

observables.label: Potential value of FloodRegulation
observables.description: The potential for flood regulation offered by the natural features in each point, considering their effect on areas downstream.
observables.extendedDescription: Warning: This observable depends on runoff water volume, which can only be calculated at the watershed scale. For this reason the system will delineate the main watershed within the current context, and then divide the sub-catchment areas and specify the watershed outlet for each sub-catchment.

observables.label: Demanded value of FloodRegulation
observables.description: The demand component for the flood regulation service, based on the presence of humans or infrastructural assets in flood-prone areas.

observables.label: Value of flood regulation
observables.description: The overall value of flood regulation in each point, combining the potential supply with the demand in the area.
observables.extendedDescription: Warning: This observable depends on runoff water volume, which can only be calculated at the watershed scale. For this reason the system will delineate the main watershed within the current context, and then divide the sub-catchment areas and specify the watershed outlet for each sub-catchment.

observables.label: Value of Outdoor Recreation
observables.description: The accrued value of outdoor recreation, combining supply and demand in each cell through a Cobb-Douglas function.

observables.label: Net value of Outdoor Recreation
observables.description: The difference between the supply and demand of outdoor recreation in each cell.

observables.label: Demanded value of Outdoor Recreation
observables.description: The demand for outdoors recreation based on population density and travel time to attractive natural areas.

observables.label: Potential Value of Outdoor Recreation
observables.description: The Recreation Opportunity Spectrum, or the potential value based on natural attractiveness and accessibility of each cell.

observables.label: Theoretical value of Outdoor Recreation
observables.description: The theoretical value for outdoor recreation based on natural values alone, without considering accessibility.

observables.label: Retained Soil Mass caused by Vegetation
observables.observable: im:Retained soil:Soil im:Mass caused by ecology:Vegetation
observables.description: The retained sediment mass due to the effect of vegetation, in tons per hectare.

observables.label: Potential Removed Soil Mass
observables.description: The result of applying the Revised Universal Soil Loss equation, representing total sediment loss.

observables.label: Combined value of ecosystem services supply
observables.description: A user-prioritized multiple criteria ranking of the region of interest according to the provision of ecosystem services.
observables.extendedDescription: A spatial multi-criteria analysis based on supply values from 5 ecosystem services: carbon storage, sediment regulation, flood regulation, pollination and outdoor recreation. The algorithm is a concordance analysis that interprets the outputs of the models through the lenses of importance weights supplied by stakeholders. The analysis runs with equal weights, but default values can be changed by the user at runtime if the EXplorer is in interactive mode.

observables.label: Maize Crop Yield
observables.description: The tannual potential maize yield, in kilograms per hectare.
observables.extendedDescription: Warning: this model assumes that all the land classified as agricultural vegetation is devoted to maize.

observables.label: Wood Biomass Harvest
observables.description: The annual potential wood biomass harvest, in cubic meters per hectare.
observables.extendedDescription: This model runs a Bayesian Network learned from data in geographical context between the Atlantic and the Mediterranean coasts in Wetsern Europe. Its extrapolation to other regions should thus be done cautiously.

observables.label: Monetary Value of Water from Forests
observables.observable: im:Potential value of hydrology:WaterVolume caused by landcover:Forest earth:Region
observables.description: Monetary value of water services, in 2013 USD (PPP)
observables.extendedDescription: This model is based on a regression function of the monetary value of water services, implemented to demonstrate spatially explicit meta-analyses.

observables.label: Monetary Value of Non-Wood Forest Products
observables.observable: im:Potential value of value of not infrastructure.incubation:Timber ecology:Biomass caused by landcover:Forest earth:Region
observables.description: Monetary value of non-wood forest products, in 2013 USD (PPP)
observables.extendedDescription: This model is based on a regression function of the monetary value of non-wood forest products, implemented to demonstrate spatially explicit meta-analyses.

observables.label: Quick-flow Water Volume
observables.description: Land surface runoff occurring during or shortly after rain events
observables.extendedDescription: Quick-flow, representing the generation of streamflow with watershed residence times of hours to days, is a function of the amount of rain runs off from the land surface quickly versus infiltrating into the soil. In the simplest version without customization, the runoff is determined with a curve number (CN)-based approach, by using event-based meteorological data and CN lookup tables based on hydrological soil groups and land-use-land-cover (LULC) types. The model computes the monthly runoff by assuming an exponential distribution of daily precipitation depths on days with rain.

observables.label: Base-flow Water Volume
observables.description: Subsurface base-flow occurring during dry weather
observables.extendedDescription: Base-flow, defined as the generation of streamflow with watershed residence times of months to years, is a function of the amount of flow leaving the pixel and of the relative contribution to recharge of this pixel. It derives from the proportion of the cumulative base-flow leaving pixels, with respect to the available recharge to the upstream cumulative recharge.

observables.label: Probability of Wildfire Ignition
observables.description: The risk of fire ignition based on social and biophisical drivers
observables.extendedDescription: A spatially distributed machine learning model trained with historical wildfire ignition data
